summary: Health and Human Services leads and coordinates the federal government's preparedness for and response to public health emergencies. This testimony discusses our work over the past decade, which identified ongoing, systemic problems with HHS's performance in this role. title: Public Health: Leading Practices Could Help Guide HHS Reform Efforts to Address Risk and Improve Preparedness
